books.title: Don Quixote
books.author: Miguel De Cervantes
books.description: The story of the gentle knight and his servant Sancho Panza has entranced readers for centuries

books.title: Pilgrim's Progress
books.author: John Bunyan
books.description: The one with the Slough of Despond and Vanity Fair

books.title: Robinson Crusoe
books.author: Daniel Defoe
books.description: The first English novel

books.title: Gulliver's Travels
books.author: Jonathan Swift
books.description: A wonderful satire that still works for all ages, despite the savagery of Swift's vision

books.title: Tom Jones
books.author: Henry Fielding
books.description: The adventures of a high-spirited orphan boy: an unbeatable plot and a lot of sex ending in a blissful marriage

books.title: Clarissa
books.author: Samuel Richardson
books.description: One of the longest novels in the English language, but unputdownable

books.title: Tristram Shandy
books.author: Laurence Sterne
books.description: One of the first bestsellers, dismissed by Dr Johnson as too fashionable for its own good

books.title: Dangerous Liaisons
books.author: Pierre Choderlos De Laclos
books.description: An epistolary novel and a handbook for seducers: foppish, French, and ferocious

books.title: Emma
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: Near impossible choice between this and Pride and Prejudice. But Emma never fails to fascinate and annoy

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.description: Inspired by spending too much time with Shelley and Byron

books.title: Nightmare Abbey
books.author: Thomas Love Peacock
books.description: A classic miniature: a brilliant satire on the Romanticnovel

books.title: The Black Sheep
books.author: Honoré De Balzac
books.description: Two rivals fight for the love of a femme fatale. Wrongly overlooked

books.title: The Charterhouse of Parma
books.author: Stendhal
books.description: Penetrating and compelling chronicle of life in an Italian court in post-Napoleonic France

books.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
books.author: Alexandre Dumas
books.description: A revenge thriller also set in France after Bonaparte: a masterpiece of adventure writing

books.title: Sybil
books.author: Benjamin Disraeli
books.description: Apart from Churchill, no other British political figure shows literary genius

books.title: David Copperfield
books.author: Charles Dickens
books.description: This highly autobiographical novel is the one its author liked best

books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.author: Emily Brontë
books.description: Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff have passed into the language. Impossible to ignore

books.title: Jane Eyre
books.author: Charlotte Brontë
books.description: Obsessive emotional grip and haunting narrative

books.title: Vanity Fair
books.author: William Makepeace Thackeray
books.description: The improving tale of Becky Sharp

books.title: The Scarlet Letter
books.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
books.description: A classic investigation of the American mind

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: 'Call me Ishmael' is one of the most famous opening sentences of any novel

books.title: Madame Bovary
books.author: Gustave Flaubert
books.description: You could summarise this as a story of adultery in provincial France, and miss the point entirely

books.title: The Woman in White
books.author: Wilkie Collins
books.description: Gripping mystery novel of concealed identity, abduction, fraud and mental cruelty

books.title: Alice's Adventures In Wonderland
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.description: A story written for the nine-year-old daughter of an Oxford don that still baffles most kids

books.title: Little Women
books.author: Louisa M. Alcott
books.description: Victorian bestseller about a New England family of girls

books.title: The Way We Live Now
books.author: Anthony Trollope
books.description: A majestic assault on the corruption of late Victorian England

books.title: Anna Karenina
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: The supreme novel of the married woman's passion for a younger man

books.title: Daniel Deronda
books.author: George Eliot
books.description: A passion and an exotic grandeur that is strange and unsettling

books.title: The Brothers Karamazov
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: Mystical tragedy by the author of Crime and Punishment

books.title: The Portrait of a Lady
books.author: Henry James
books.description: The story of Isabel Archer shows James at his witty and polished best

books.title: Huckleberry Finn
books.author: Mark Twain
books.description: Twain was a humorist, but this picture of Mississippi life is profoundly moral and still incredibly influential

books.title: The Strange Case of Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.description: A brilliantly suggestive, resonant study of human duality by a natural storyteller

books.title: Three Men in a Boat
books.author: Jerome K. Jerome
books.description: One of the funniest English books ever written

books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.description: A coded and epigrammatic melodrama inspired by his own tortured homosexuality

books.title: The Diary of a Nobody
books.author: George Grossmith
books.description: This classic of Victorian suburbia will always be renowned for the character of Mr Pooter

books.title: Jude the Obscure
books.author: Thomas Hardy
books.description: Its savage bleakness makes it one of the first twentieth-century novels

books.title: The Riddle of the Sands
books.author: Erskine Childers
books.description: A prewar invasion-scare spy thriller by a writer later shot for his part in the Irish republican rising

books.title: The Call of the Wild
books.author: Jack London
books.description: The story of a dog who joins a pack of wolves after his master's death

books.title: Nostromo
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.description: Conrad's masterpiece: a tale of money, love and revolutionary politics

books.title: The Wind in the Willows
books.author: Kenneth Grahame
books.description: This children's classic was inspired by bedtime stories for Grahame's son

books.title: In Search of Lost Time
books.author: Marcel Proust
books.description: An unforgettable portrait of Paris in the belle époque. Probably the longest novel on this list

books.title: The Rainbow
books.author: D. H. Lawrence
books.description: Novels seized by the police, like this one, have a special afterlife

books.title: The Good Soldier
books.author: Ford Madox Ford
books.description: This account of the adulterous lives of two Edwardian couples is a classic of unreliable narration

books.title: The Thirty-Nine Steps
books.author: John Buchan
books.description: A classic adventure story for boys, jammed with action, violence and suspense

books.title: Ulysses
books.author: James Joyce
books.description: Also pursued by the British police, this is a novel more discussed than read

books.title: Mrs Dalloway
books.author: Virginia Woolf
books.description: Secures Woolf's position as one of the great twentieth-century English novelists

books.title: A Passage to India
books.author: EM Forster
books.description: Forster's great love song to India

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: The quintessential Jazz Age novel

books.title: The Trial
books.author: Franz Kafka
books.description: The enigmatic story of Joseph K

books.title: Men Without Women
books.author: Ernest Hemingway
books.description: He is remembered for his novels, but it was the short stories that first attracted notice

books.title: Journey to the End of the Night
books.author: Louis-Ferdinand Celine
books.description: The experiences of an unattractive slum doctor during the Great War: a masterpiece of linguistic innovation

books.title: As I Lay Dying
books.author: William Faulkner
books.description: A strange black comedy by an American master

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: Dystopian fantasy about the world of the seventh century AF (after Ford)

books.title: Scoop
books.author: Evelyn Waugh
books.description: The supreme Fleet Street novel

books.title: USA
books.author: John Dos Passos
books.description: An extraordinary trilogy that uses a variety of narrative devices to express the story of America.

books.title: The Big Sleep
books.author: Raymond Chandler
books.description: Introducing Philip Marlowe: cool, sharp, handsome - and bitterly alone

books.title: The Pursuit Of Love
books.author: Nancy Mitford
books.description: An exquisite comedy of manners with countless fans

books.title: The Plague
books.author: Albert Camus
books.description: A mysterious plague sweeps through the Algerian town of Oran

books.title: Nineteen Eighty-Four
books.author: George Orwell
books.description: This tale of one man's struggle against totalitarianism has been appropriated the world over

books.title: Malone Dies
books.author: Samuel Beckett
books.description: Part of a trilogy of astonishing monologues in the black comic voice of the author of Waiting for Godot

books.title: Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A week in the life of Holden Caulfield. A cult novel that still mesmerises

books.title: Wise Blood
books.author: Flannery O'Connor
books.description: A disturbing novel of religious extremism set in the Deep South

books.title: Charlotte's Web
books.author: EB White
books.description: How Wilbur the pig was saved by the literary genius of a friendly spider

books.title: The Lord Of The Rings
books.author: J. R. R. Tolkien
books.description: Enough said!

books.title: Lucky Jim
books.author: Kingsley Amis
books.description: An astonishing debut: the painfully funny English novel of the Fifties

books.title: Lord of the Flies
books.author: William Golding
books.description: Schoolboys become savages: a bleak vision of human nature

books.title: The Quiet American
books.author: Graham Greene
books.description: Prophetic novel set in 1950s Vietnam

books.title: On the Road
books.author: Jack Kerouac
books.description: The Beat Generation bible

books.title: Lolita
books.author: Vladimir Nabokov
books.description: Humbert Humbert's obsession with Lolita is a tour de force of style and narrative

books.title: The Tin Drum
books.author: Günter Grass
books.description: Hugely influential, Rabelaisian novel of Hitler's Germany

books.title: Things Fall Apart
books.author: Chinua Achebe
books.description: Nigeria at the beginning of colonialism. A classic of African literature

books.title: The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
books.author: Muriel Spark
books.description: A writer who made her debut in The Observer - and her prose is like cut glass

books.title: To Kill A Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: Scout, a six-year-old girl, narrates an enthralling story of racial prejudice in the Deep South

books.title: Catch-22
books.author: Joseph Heller
books.description: He would be crazy to fly more missions and sane if he didn't, but if he was sane he had to fly them

books.title: Herzog
books.author: Saul Bellow
books.description: Adultery and nervous breakdown in Chicago

books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.author: Gabriel García Márquez
books.description: A postmodern masterpiece

books.title: Mrs Palfrey at the Claremont
books.author: Elizabeth Taylor
books.description: A haunting, understated study of old age

books.title: Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy
books.author: John Le Carré
books.description: A thrilling elegy for post-imperial Britain

books.title: Song of Solomon
books.author: Toni Morrison
books.description: The definitive novelist of the African-American experience

books.title: The Bottle Factory Outing
books.author: Beryl Bainbridge
books.description: Macabre comedy of provincial life

books.title: The Executioner's Song
books.author: Norman Mailer
books.description: This quasi-documentary account of the life and death of Gary Gilmore is possibly his masterpiece

books.title: If on a Winter's Night a Traveller
books.author: Italo Calvino
books.description: A strange, compelling story about the pleasures of reading

books.title: A Bend in the River
books.author: VS Naipaul
books.description: The finest living writer of English prose. This is his masterpiece: edgily reminiscent of Heart of Darkness

books.title: Waiting for the Barbarians
books.author: JM Coetzee
books.description: Bleak but haunting allegory of apartheid by the Nobel prizewinner

books.title: Housekeeping
books.author: Marilynne Robinson
books.description: Haunting, poetic story, drowned in water and light, about three generations of women

books.title: Lanark
books.author: Alasdair Gray
books.description: Seething vision of Glasgow. A Scottish classic

books.title: The New York Trilogy
books.author: Paul Auster
books.description: Dazzling metaphysical thriller set in the Manhattan of the 1970s

books.title: The BFG
books.author: Roald Dahl
books.description: A bestseller by the most popular postwar writer for children of all ages

books.title: The Periodic Table
books.author: Primo Levi
books.description: A prose poem about the delights of chemistry

books.title: Money
books.author: Martin Amis
books.description: The novel that bags Amis's place on any list

books.title: An Artist of the Floating World
books.author: Kazuo Ishiguro
books.description: A collaborator from prewar Japan reluctantly discloses his betrayal of friends and family

books.title: Oscar And Lucinda
books.author: Peter Carey
books.description: A great contemporary love story set in nineteenth-century Australia by double Booker prizewinner

books.title: The Book of Laughter and Forgetting
books.author: Milan Kundera
books.description: Inspired by the Soviet invasion of Czechoslovakia in 1968, this is a magical fusion of history, autobiography and ideas

books.title: Haroun and the Sea of Stories
books.author: Salman Rushdie
books.description: In this entrancing story Rushdie plays with the idea of narrative itself

books.title: LA Confidential
books.author: James Ellroy
books.description: Three LAPD detectives are brought face to face with the secrets of their corrupt and violent careers

books.title: Wise Children
books.author: Angela Carter
books.description: A theatrical extravaganza by a brilliant exponent of magic realism

books.title: Atonement
books.author: Ian McEwan
books.description: Acclaimed short-story writer achieves a contemporary classic of mesmerising narrative conviction

books.title: Northern Lights
books.author: Philip Pullman
books.description: Lyra's quest weaves fantasy, horror and the play of ideas into a truly great contemporary children's book

books.title: American Pastoral
books.author: Philip Roth
books.description: For years, Roth was famous for Portnoy's Complaint . Recently, he has enjoyed an extraordinary revival

books.title: Austerlitz
books.author: W. G. Sebald
books.description: Posthumously published volume in a sequence of dream-like fictions spun from memory, photographs and the German past
